description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes five minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ’Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on your business’s trading status.
This section asks for information about:

list: factors impacting your business’s supply chains
increasing supply chain resilience

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: current actions taken by your business to protect the environment and reduce carbon emissions
current actions taken by your business to address the impacts of nature or biodiversity risks
assessing climate change risks and effects
the impact of severe weather events on your business

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business’s use of artificial intelligence technologies.
This section asks for information about:

list: expectations for cash reserves
insolvency
debt obligations

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: your business’s exporting activities
your business’s importing activities

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the US
intentions to open any new branches or subsidiaries in the US
the impact of US tariff changes on your business

contents.description: The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

summary.page_title: Trading status of your business section

blocks.page_title: Trading status of your business

contents.description: This section asks for general information on your business’s trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}’s trading status?

description:
You can interpret ’trading’ as ’operating’.

Only select ’paused trading’ if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.page_title: Trading status
Supply chain section

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: factors impacting your business’s supply chains
increasing supply chain resilience

title.text: Which of the following factors, if any, is {ru_name} concerned about impacting supply chains over the next 12 months?

options.label: Increased barriers to trade
options.description: This refers to barriers that make it more difficult for businesses to source the inputs they are seeking from a given market. These can include tariff increases and new regulations

options.label: Market distorting practices
options.description: This refers to practices that may undermine free and fair trade and prevent businesses from competing based on merit

options.label: Nature and biodiversity risks
options.description: This refers to the negative impacts businesses may face if for example the environment is damaged or species are lost

options.label: Shipping disruption
options.description: For example, the Red Sea crisis

options.label: Business is not concerned about factors impacting supply chains over the next 12 months

blocks.page_title: Factors impacting supply chains in next 12 months

question.title: How does your business expect these factors to impact supply chains?

options.label: Shortage of inputs
options.description: This refers to any resources used to create goods and services. These include intermediate goods used in production, labour, fuel, and equipment

options.label: Business does not expect these factors to impact supply chains

blocks.page_title: Expected impact to supply chains

question.title: Which of the following actions, if any, did your business take to increase supply chain resilience in the last 12 months?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’increase supply chain resilience’

contents.description: This refers to the ability of the business to respond to disruptions and reduces the likelihood and scale of any future disruptions.

options.label: Demand management
options.description: For example, identifying whether it is beneficial to manage the demand for components or goods, considering substitutes and alternatives, innovation, and circularity

options.label: Diversification of suppliers across a broader range of countries
Increased awareness of supply chains
options.description: For example, greater data gathering and sharing

options.label: Onshoring
options.description: This refers to sourcing inputs from the company’s original country

options.label: Relocated existing sourcing to another country

blocks.page_title: Actions taken to increase supply chain resilience

question.title: Which of the following actions, if any, does your business plan to take to increase supply chain resilience over the next 12 months?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’increase supply chain resilience’

contents.description: This refers to the ability of the business to respond to disruptions and reduces the likelihood and scale of any future disruptions.

options.label: Demand management
options.description: For example, identifying whether it is beneficial to manage the demand for components or goods, considering substitutes and alternatives, innovation, and circularity

options.label: Diversification of suppliers across a broader range of countries
Increase awareness of supply chains
options.description: For example, greater data gathering and sharing

options.label: Onshoring
options.description: This refers to sourcing inputs from the company’s original country

options.label: Relocate existing sourcing to another country

blocks.page_title: Planned actions to increase supply chain resilience
Environment

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: current actions taken by your business to protect the environment and reduce carbon emissions
current actions taken by your business to address the impacts of nature or biodiversity risks
assessing climate change risks and effects
the impact of severe weather events on your business

title.text: Is {ru_name} concerned about the impact climate change may have on the business?

blocks.page_title: Addressing the impacts of climate change

question.title: Is your business concerned about the impact nature or biodiversity risks may have on the business?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’nature or biodiversity risks’

contents.description: This refers to the negative impacts businesses may face if for example the environment is damaged or species are lost

blocks.page_title: Addressing the impacts of nature or biodiversity risks

question.title: Which of the following actions, if any, has your business taken to protect the environment?

options.label: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target
Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target which includes supply chain
Has a nature or biodiversity strategy
Has a nature or biodiversity target
Has a nature or biodiversity target which includes supply chain
Has invested in nature or biodiversity projects
options.description: For example, conservation or restoration projects

options.label: Monitors climate-related risks
options.description: For example, increased frequency or severity of extreme weather conditions, floods, droughts, fires and sea level rises

options.label: Monitors nature or biodiversity-related risks
options.description: For example, disruption to supply chains, increasing regulatory compliance costs, fluctuating prices, environmental degradation and small crop yields

blocks.page_title: Actions taken to protect the environment

question.title: What barriers, if any, prevent action being taken by your business to tackle environmental issues?

options.label: Lack of internal expertise or knowledge
Limited access to finance or grants
Limited time or capacity to act
Unclear on what actions to take

blocks.page_title: Barriers to tackling environmental issues

question.title: Which of the following actions, if any, has your business taken to reduce carbon emissions?

options.label: Adjusting heating and cooling systems
options.description: For example, temperature, timings and reducing number of rooms being heated or cooled

options.label: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating
Introducing a cycle to work scheme
Investing in or delivering nature-based solutions
options.description: For example, tree planting or wetland restoration

options.label: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions

blocks.page_title: Actions taken to reduce carbon emissions

question.title: For which, if any, of the following effects of climate change has your business assessed risks?

definitions.title: What we mean by assessing climate risks

contents.description: This refers to considering any of the following three main elements of climate risk:

list: assessing potential hazards, for example, extreme climate-induced events
gauging exposure, for example, the susceptibility to that hazard based on location, age, or quality of asset
judging vulnerability, for example, taking into account demographic or socioeconomic factors that might make it harder to prepare or respond, adaptive capacity

blocks.page_title: Assessed the risks of the effects of climate change

question.title: Which, if any, of the following effects of climate change has your business taken action to adapt to?

contents.description: Exclude mitigation, which refers to the reduction of emissions of greenhouse gases that lead to global warming

definitions.title: What we mean by ’taken action to adapt to’

contents.description: This refers to the action made to adjust to climate change and the extreme weather. For example, making buildings more resilient to extreme heat and cold weather, flooding, or drought events.

blocks.page_title: Actions to adapt to the effects of climate change

question.title: Which, if any, of the following reasons have prevented your business from taking action against any of these climate change effects?

contents.description: Include:

list: coastal erosion
increased flooding
temperature increases
supply chain disruption and distribution
water scarcity

options.label: Business has been unable to take action due to costs
Business has been unable to take action due to lack of information or guidance
Business does not expect to be impacted by these effects
Business has not been prevented from taking action

blocks.page_title: Reasons preventing action against climate change effects

question.title: Which of the following severe weather events, if any, has your business been impacted by in the last 12 months?

options.label: Business has not been impacted by any severe weather events

blocks.page_title: Severe weather events

question.title: How has your business been impacted by severe weather events in the last 12 months?

options.label: Weather related damage to physical infrastructure

blocks.page_title: Impact of severe weather events
Technology

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business’s use of artificial intelligence technologies.

title.text: Which of the following artificial intelligence technologies, if any, does {ru_name} currently use?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’artificial intelligence technologies’

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Data processing using machine learning
options.description: For example, personalisation of shopping or product recommendations, fraud prevention or cybersecurity

options.label: Image processing using machine learning
options.description: For example, for facial recognition, quality control or object detection

options.label: Robotics
options.description: For example, for carrying goods in hospitals or warehouses

options.label: Text generation using Large Language Models
options.description: For example, chatbots that interact in a conversational way and can answer complex questions, computer coding assistance, creating first drafts of papers or topic research or social media posts and public communications

options.label: Visual content creation
options.description: For example, for use in graphic design or videos

options.label: Business does not currently use artificial intelligence technologies

blocks.page_title: Current use of artificial intelligence technologies

question.title: What does your business currently use artificial intelligence technologies for?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’artificial intelligence technologies’

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Develop a new product or service
options.description: Including product or service improvements and user testing

options.label: Explore a new market
options.description: Including forecasting

options.label: Improve business operations
options.description: For example, to increase productivity, create efficiencies or to reduce costs

options.label: Provide, or personalise, products or services to customers

blocks.page_title: How artificial intelligence technologies are used

question.title: How did your business adopt these artificial intelligence technologies?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’artificial intelligence technologies’

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Developed in-house
options.description: Fully, or by adapting existing software

options.label: Outsourced to external providers or third parties
Through purchase of external software or ready-to-use

blocks.page_title: Adopting artificial intelligence technologies

question.title: What roles, if any, have been most impacted by artificial intelligence technologies your business has adopted?

options.label: Administrative or clerical roles
options.description: For example, administrative occupations in government, finance, records or secretarial and related occupations

options.label: Creative or design roles
options.description: For example, graphic designer, web designer, multimedia designer, copywriter

options.label: Data analysis roles
options.description: For example, market research analyst, business analyst, technical analyst

options.label: Information Technology roles
options.description: For example, software engineer, database developer, software testers, network installation engineer

options.label: Managerial roles
options.description: For example, finance director, sales director, store manager, supply chain director, technical director

options.label: Sales and customer service roles
options.description: For example, sales assistant, retail cashier, telephone salesperson

options.label: Skilled, manual or operational roles
options.description: For example, carpenter, forklift driver, care worker, cleaner

blocks.page_title: Roles impacted by artificial intelligence

question.title: What has been your business’s approach to integrating artificial intelligence technology related skills into your workforce?

options.label: Automating or replacing roles with artificial intelligence technologies
Recruiting new staff with artificial intelligence related skills

blocks.page_title: Business approach to integration of artificial intelligence into workforce

question.title: What impact, if any, have artificial intelligence technologies had on your business’s overall workforce headcount?

blocks.page_title: Impact of artificial intelligence on headcount

question.title: Which of the following artificial intelligence technologies, if any, does your business plan to adopt within the next three months?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’artificial intelligence technologies’

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Data processing using machine learning
options.description: For example, personalisation of shopping or product recommendations, fraud prevention or cybersecurity

options.description: For example, for facial recognition, quality control or object detection

options.description: For example, chatbots that interact in a conversational way and can answer complex questions, computer coding assistance, creating first drafts of papers or topic research or social media posts and public communications

options.label: Visual content creation
options.description: For example, for use in graphic design or videos

options.label: Business does not plan to adopt artificial intelligence technologies in the next three months

definitions.title: What we mean by ’artificial intelligence technologies’

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Develop a new product or service
options.description: Including product or service improvements and user testing

options.label: Explore a new market

question.title: What will be your business’s approach to integrating your planned artificial intelligence technology related skills into your workforce?

options.label: Automating or replacing roles with artificial intelligence technologies
Recruiting new staff with artificial intelligence technology related skills

blocks.page_title: Approach to integration of artificial intelligence technology skills into workforce

question.title: What impact, if any, do you expect the artificial intelligence technologies your business is planning to adopt will have on your overall workforce headcount?

blocks.page_title: Impact of artificial technologies on overall workforce headcount

question.title: In the last three months, which of the following factors, if any, have prevented or delayed your business from adopting artificial intelligence technologies?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’artificial intelligence technologies’

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Employee concern about any potential impact of using artificial intelligence technologies
options.description: For example, concern about job security, safety of implementation and usage, efficiency, impacts on workload, privacy or other moral concerns

options.label: Level of expertise in artificial intelligence
Uncertainty about government regulations or industry standards
Business has not attempted to use artificial intelligence technologies
Business has not been prevented or experienced delays in the adoption of artificial intelligence technologies

blocks.page_title: Prevented or delayed use of artificial intelligence technologies
Business operations section

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: expectations for cash reserves
insolvency
debt obligations

title.text: How long do you expect {ru_name}’s cash reserves will last?

blocks.page_title: Cash reserves

question.title: What is your business’s risk of insolvency?

contents.description: This refers to when a business cannot pay its debts when they are due or the business owes more than it owns.

blocks.page_title: Risk of insolvency

question.title: How much confidence does your business have that it will meet its current debt obligations?

options.label: Business does not have any debt obligations

blocks.page_title: Confidence in meeting debt obligations
Export/import section

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: your business’s exporting activities
your business’s importing activities

title.text: Has {ru_name} exported goods or services in the last 12 months?

contents.description: Include exporting services from your businesses in the UK to an individual or business located outside of the UK
This refers to skills and services that are provided by people and are ’intangible’.
For example, your business may provide a service, such as legal or financial services, to a non-UK business.

options.label: Business has not exported goods or services in the last 12 months

blocks.page_title: Export of goods or services

question.title: Has your business imported goods or services in the last 12 months?

contents.description: Include importing services from an individual or business located outside of the UK to your businesses in the UK
This refers to skills and services that are provided by people and are ’intangible’.
For example, your business may receive a service, such as research or construction, from a non-UK business.

options.label: Business has not imported goods or services in the last 12 months

blocks.page_title: Import of goods or services
International trade section

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the US
intentions to open any new branches or subsidiaries in the US
the impact of US tariff changes on your business

title.text: Was {ru_name} able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from the US in August 2025?

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

blocks.page_title: Materials, goods or services from the US

question.title: Does your business intend to open any new branches or subsidiaries in the US in the next 12 months?

blocks.page_title: Plans to open branches or subsidiaries in the US

question.title: What impact, if any, did the United States tariffs have on your business in the last month?

contents.description: Include impacts from other countries in your supply chain that are being affected by the United States tariffs

options.label: Business passed additional costs to customers
Business stopped or paused exports to the United States

blocks.page_title: Impact of US tariffs in the last month

question.title: What impact, if any, do you expect the United States tariffs to have on your business in the next month?

contents.description: Include impacts from other countries in your supply chain that are being affected by the United States tariffs

options.label: Business will explore new export markets
Business will pass additional costs to customers
Business will stop or pause exports to the United States
No impact expected for the business

blocks.page_title: Impact of US tariffs in the next month
